direction.raw_text: Deckard reels out.  The door swings shut and he's sober as hell and moving fast.  Around the big trash dumpster alongside the building, he plasters himself against the wall and his gun is out, aimed at the door.  He's in a good spot with a perfect line of fire.  Moments go by and he's glad for the time to steady himself.  The
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: of his BREATHING, the HUM of the city and the quiet. Suddenly from behind, Deckard is swept off his feet and twirled around in Leon's bear-trap embrace. Leon lets go and Deckard hits the pavement, skidding hard enough to tear clothes and burn skin, but he rolls out of it and comes up with gun in hand; but Leon is so fast he's already there and kicks it out of his hand. Leon moves towards him, backing Deckard against the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come you know where Zhora was so quick? His hand is lightning.  It shoots out, grabs Deckard's hair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I showed pictures.  Somebody recognized her.  I went to see. Deckard is pale.  The sweat is starting to run.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How old am I?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know. The grip tightens and twists.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: My birthday is April 10, 2015. How long do I live?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Four years. He lets go.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: More than you. Deckard's knees come up fast.  Leon's fist comes down faster, like a hammer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Painful to live in fear, isn't it. Deckard is doubled over, hugging his thigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But that's how it is to be a slave.  The future is sealed off, he grovels, he waits. Even hurt, Deckard is fast.  He goes for his ankle gun, but Leon's got it out of his hand before he can even raise it and throws it down the alley. Deckard hurls forward, knocking him off balance, and scrambles to get away.  Leon grabs him by the foot, drags him back and jerks him off the ground.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sex, reproduction, security, the simple things.  But no way to satisfy them.  To be homesick with no place to go.  Potential with no way to use it.  Lots of little oversights in the Nexus 6. He slams Deckard into the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I tell you, nothing is worse than having an itch you can never scratch. Deckard slides down the wall to his knees and huddles, protecting his head with his arms, waiting for the next one. Leon folds his big hands together and raises them over his head, pausing just a second to savor the satisfac- tion of smashing Deckard's skull. The spasm that runs through Leon's face is not from satisfaction.  It's the bullet that went through his neck.  He hits the ground hard, his big teeth biting the air like a rabid dog.  Dead. Rachael is standing in the alley.  Deckard lies there looking at her.  She comes slowly and quietly forward and drops Deckard's gun by his side. Deckard gets to his hands and knees and tries to get up, but can't quite manage it.  He looks up at her, panting, spits blood and almost smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like I said, I don't need your help. After a long moment, she bends down to touch him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You look terrible, you know that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's lying in the tub with a drink, eyes half mast, water up to his chin, bruised and beat, but looking just a little wicked in his balmy luxury.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I knew a cop once who was involved in a high-speed chase.  They shot out one of his tires and he went over a cliff at hundred and fifty miles an hour.  They found him in the morning with a broken skull, six fractured ribs and second- degree burns.  On the way to the hospital he made a play for the nurse. He takes a drink and clears his throat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey!  I thought you were supposed to be taking care of me.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you need? He doesn't answer.  Lies there sipping his drink. Rachael comes in a little uncertain, a little droll, and stands there looking down at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't just stand there looking at me.  It's not polite.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do you want me to do?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit. She sits on the edge of the tub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Gimme your arm. She's wearing a short-sleeved dress.  It's a long, del- icate arm and Deckard holds it, inspecting it like a maestro with a Stradivarius.  He looks up at her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You ever take a bath with a man before?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a lot I haven't done with a man before. He's got her hand in the water and had begun to soap her arm.  Starting with her wrist and running the bar to her elbow, up and down, slow and slippery.  She watches, not quite sure of the ritual. He pulls her closer, and runs his hand up higher, mould- ing and pressing, working around her flesh, up and under her arm into the privacy of her dress.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're getting me wet. Oh, yes.  For a moment Deckard stares at her like some furry-legged satyr in rut, the fingers of his other hand rake through her hair and into the water she comes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bed looks like it was hit by a storm and Deckard looks like something that was washed up in it.  He's spread out flat, face creased and puffed. His eyes squint open, but only for a moment.  His hands are more reliable.  They search over the bed, but find it bare.  He edges his head over the side, looking around for signs, but she's all gone.  He gets up in two stages, sits and then stands.  Then sits again, resting his head in his hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard's got his face in the mirror shaving it.  It's been a long night.  Nothing a new tongue and a trans- fusion wouldn't put right.  He moves a couple of inches to the left so his eyes have a view of the tub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard is on the edge of the couch with the phone on his knees, the card with Rachael's number in his lap and having no luck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry, I am not in at the moment, but if you'll leave your name and number I'll return your call as soon as I can. That's not soon enough.  Deckard hangs up, puts the phone on the floor and leans back on the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fuck you, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . DEETCHUM'S APARTMENT - MORNING                 74 The rooster perched on the chair spreading its scrawny wings, strains from the tips of its toes, crowing at the ceiling.  Between crows there's a TAPPING at the door. You might call this a "barnyard" apartment.  There's straw on the floor and several hens roosting against the back wall.  The front door opens a few inches and Sebastian pokes his head in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Deetchum?  Hello? Nobody seems to be home except his chickens.  As Sebas- tian enters, closing the door behind him, a goose charges out of the bedroom hissing and honking.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Now, now, Waddles. Seeming to recognize Sebastian as no intruder, Waddles veers off from the attack.  As Sebastian crosses the room a pig peeks out from behind the couch.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Wrigley. He goes to the chickens and collects some eggs, putting them into a bowl he's brought.  He puts down the bowl and reaching into his pocket carefully counts out the payment and puts the money on a plate.  He's about to leave but notices there's no water in the dispenser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Deetchum isn't taking very good care of you people. Pouring from a jug on the table, he fills the dispenser with water, scatters a little grain on the floor, gets his bowel of eggs and leaves. Wrigley grunts and comes out from behind the couch for a long drink.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian arrives on his floor, walks down the hall to his apartment, opens the door, walks in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns to close door, comes face to face with Roy Batty.  Sebastian drops his bowl of eggs.  Batty's hand flashes out and catches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Whoops. Smiling, Batty hands them back to Sebastian, who is too startled to speak. Pris runs up and gives Batty and Mary a big hug, steps back effusing and smiling, everybody's favorite teen- ager.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is my Uncle Roy, Sebastian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, glad to meet you. He pumps Sebastian's free hand.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And my Aunt Mary. Sebastian turns and there's Aunt Mary, modest and warm.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And this is my savior, J.F. Sebastian, everybody. Sebastian stands there with his eggs, bashful and ex- cited, the hero of this little family's warm attention.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't thank you enough, Mr. Sebastian. If you hadn't come along...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We were worried to death.  It's awfully kind of you. Sebastian is nodding and smiling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not used to the big city. Where we come from it's not so easy to get lost.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You certainly have a nice place here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well stocked. Batty looks around admiringly.  Sebastian mumbles some- thing that sounds like "Thank you."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian doesn't like to go out too much.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I keep a lot of provisions right here.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I like a man who stays put.  An admirable thing to be able to sustain yourself in these times. You live here all by yourself, do you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, no, not really.  There's Mr. Deetchum, he's the watchman, he lives on the first floor. Everybody nods.  A long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We haven't found it easy, Mr. Sebastian. They glance around the room, waiting for Sebastian to pick up the ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about breakfast, I was just going to make some.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If it wouldn't be too much of a bother... a little bite to eat would be...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, no bother, I'd be glad to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, actually
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're famished. Sebastian is truly happy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, then.  You make yourselves comfortable and I'll bring the food right out. He disappears into the kitchen.  Batty looks happy with the way things are going.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Charming. Pris comes up close.  Her tone muted but demanding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well? Batty finds her attitude amusing, which makes her even more pugnacious.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to know what's going on. There's a punitive edge to Batty's response.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's only three of us left. Pris is shocked.  Her whisper comes out a hiss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then we're stupid and we'll die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not if everybody is doing their job here at home.  How are things at home? A little spotted pig on the table sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Home again, jiggidy jig. They all turn and stare at the pig.  Batty is delighted.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't trust him.  I don't think he knows what he's doing. The BELL-TONE from the microwave goes off in the kitchen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He knows what he's doing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If he won't cooperate?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mr. Sebastian is a host who wants to be appreciated.  We'll appreciate him and he'll cooperate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Holden is laid out in an apparatus that resembles an iron lung.  A little above his head, facing him, is a bank of bio-feedback lights registering body functions. Deckard is in a chair sitting next to his friend. Holden has lost weight, his face is grey, he can't move his head, but he's smiling like the cat who ate the canary.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you doing, old man? Holden's voice is just a whisper -- the kind of whisper that comes out of the joker at the back of the class.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm great.  I mean, I know I'm not really great, but I feel just great.  How you like my new suit?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well, you don't have to worry about getting it wrinkled. Holden's eyes close, his smile gets bigger and little spasms of laughter pump out of his mouth.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't make me laugh.  It makes me pee.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sorry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hey, it's okay.  I like to pee. So how are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm doing okay.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From what I hear you're doing great.  Bryant tells me you're going like a god damn one-man army.  Making a lot of money, huh?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah. (pause) But that's what I wanted to talk to you about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Money?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  I got a problem.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's hear it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think I'm starting to empathize with these Nexus-sixes. Holden giggles.  Starts to laugh again.  A blue light on the panel begins to turn very bright.  They both notice it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's that?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm taking a piss. They wait for the light to abate.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let me ask you something, Deck. You been having intimate relations with one of these units? Deckard doesn't deny it.  Holden smiles like a cherub.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's what I thought... one of the liabilities of the trade -- you has sex with your prey, old buddy.  That's bound to create problems, unless you're a black widow. Deckard has to wait for him to stop giggling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about -- not sex -- but love? Holden bites his bottom lip to keep the laugher out of his voice, but he can't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Love is just another name for sex. Love is sexy and sex is lovely -- I don't care what you call it, an android can't have it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These aren't just...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I know what they are, Deck -- Look, maybe they can pretend to feel, but far as the raw, hot emotions of the old heart -- no way. Holden stops talking for a moment to get some air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, take it from an old pro, no matter how good we get, we're never gonna make an artificial anything that can feel.  It's a contradiction. You might as well go fuck your washing machine. Holden laughs, Deckard doesn't.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just go out there and keep up the good work. Holden's whispers have become harder to hear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got to save it, Deck, I'm getting sleepy.  It's been good talking to you. Deckard stands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thanks. But he's already asleep.  Deckard stands there a moment looking at him, then walks out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's sitting on the couch, glum, contemplative. There's a SOUND.  His eyes move to the door.  Those locks are opening again.  Rachael comes in.  Looks surprised to see him.  Him too.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I told you I'd come back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You did?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You didn't hear me.  You were sleeping. He likes that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Are you glad I'm here? He is.  She's spunky.  Hasn't seen this place in the daytime.  Pleased, he watched her move around the mess. She spots a little framed photograph.  Picks it up. It's a man with a shotgun and a boy holding up a quail.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who is this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Me and my dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where is he?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dead.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh. She puts it down and comes to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How come you're not on the job?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am.  Part of my job is to sit on a couch and try and figure things out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How are you doing?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not too good. She sits next to him. Pleased as hell, they both sit there staring straight ahead.  He looks at her.  She looks at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What do people do in the afternoon?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If they are smart, they take naps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They're under the sheet.  Rachael is on her back, look- ing at the ceiling, hair sprawled like sea grass over the pillow.  Deckard lies next to her, a man studying a treasure.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you dream?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  Sometimes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I wish I could. His hand moves over her shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wishing is a kind of dreaming. His hand goes under the sheet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I mean asleep. She feels good.  He moves closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Did you cry when your father died?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's another thing I can't do. He kisses her lightly on the cheek.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nobody is freer than when he dreams.  I read that.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It wasn't very good last night, was it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know, I have nothing to compare it to.  I guess I thought there was something more to it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know... I think I missed something.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm not sure.  Is there a secret? Her face is close.  She's looking right at him.  Her lips are right there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know.  If there is I'd like to find it. Slowly their lips touch and his arms slide under her body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Batty, Pris and Mary sit at the table staring at their host.  Sebastian is staring back, his fork halfway to his mouth, looking from face to face.  Although nothing is being said, he's totally comfortable, as much at home with them as he is with his animoids.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why are you staring at us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're just all so... so different. Batty nods his head, smiling, sending home the fact and Sebastian is certainly getting it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What, Sebastian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're androids. A long pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What makes you think so?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're all so perfect. Sebastian is smiling from ear to ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What generation are you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nexus - 6. Sebastian whistles.  Mary's head is shaking slightly. Pris gets up and moves to the couch.  Batty couldn't be more pleased.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We can trust Sebastian, ladies. He's been working with mechanisms all his life.  He's a wizard and a very perceptive man. Sebastian looks like a kid on Christmas Eve.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could you... His voice is trembling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Show me something?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like what?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Like... Like a million things, but he's too excited to think of one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We're not computers, Sebastian, we're physical. Pris perks up proudly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I think, therefore I am.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Very good, Pris.  Now show him why. It's a command Pris is pleased to obey.  She sits quiet- ly a moment, hands folded in her lap, prim and proper. Mary doesn't like these displays, but Batty is beaming. Those hands in Pris' lap suddenly move, almost faster than the eye can see and slam down on either side of her, digging into the material with such ferocity that Sebastian jumps.  She plunges into the guts of the couch up to her elbows and comes up holding springs and stuff- ing.  Except for the clenched teeth, she is smiling like an angel. Sebastian is riveted, his eyes wide and astounded, like he's just seen the devil.  He laughs nervously, glad that the devil is a friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We have a lot in common.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean that you can't come here and I can't go there?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not only that, but we have smiliar problems.  Accelerated decrepitude. But we don't want to die quite yet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Of course not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You could help us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't know much about biomechanics, Roy.  I wish I did, but you're out of my league.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If we don't find help soon, Pris hasn't got long to live. Sebastian sneaks a glance.  Pris is staring at him with big childlike eyes, Sebastian looks back at Batty, moved but helpless.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about your friend, the man who owns this building?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dr. Tyrell? Batty nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's not really my friend.  I just do a job for him now and then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyrell could help us, Sebastian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He could?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His company made us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'd be happy to mention it to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Be better if I could talk to him in person.  But he's not an easy man to get to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When do you deliver your project?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This afternoon. Batty leans forward and looks right into Sebastian's eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Will you help us? There's no way Sebastian could say no, even if he wanted to.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes. Pris sits up smiling.  Mary sighs a breath of relief and Batty leans back nodding in gratitude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm sure glad you found us, Sebastian.  What do you think, Mary?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't think there is another human being in this whole world who would have helped us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pris? Pris gets up and comes to Sebastian and kisses him. That has a lot of impact.  Sebastian looks around try- ing to keep the tears from coming.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're our best and only friend.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Rachael is lying across the bed in one of Deckard's shirts, her chin over the edge, her eyes moving around the room.  Deckard lies next to her.  Looking like a man who died a voluptuous death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: When was the last time you cleaned this place?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hmmm?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever cleaned your apartment?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't be fooled by appearances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It appears to be dirty -- why don't you get somebody? He rolls over to admire her legs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because they would ruin the arrangement. He kisses the back of her thigh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They could clean around the arrangement.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like people snooping around my stuff. He kisses her other thigh, gets up and goes into the bathroom.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There's a vacuum in the front room closet is you wanna give it a try. Rachael lies there a moment, then gets up and goes into the front room and opens the closet door.  The vacuum is not easy to get to, but finally she wrestles it out.  As she starts to plug it in -- DECKARD Oh no, don't do that. He's wrapped in a sheet, watching her from the doorway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But if I don't plug it in how can I...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Never mind the plug, just go through the motions.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But then how can you...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I don't like the noise.  Just practice.  Practice makes perfect. She stares at him like he's nuts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm serious.  Go ahead.  Show me how you would do it. Reluctantly she makes some half-hearted passes with the thing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: How about under the couch there. Come on. She bends over to get it.  Deckard pulls up a chair and sits down with his chin in his hands.  She looks back at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This feels stupid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Good for a smart girl to feel stupid.  Part of your education. She drops the vacuum and sits on the floor.  Deckard gets up and comes towards her.  Her eyes travel halfway down his sheet and she leaves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You're sick, Deckard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I never felt better.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Mansion and opulent grounds.  Sebastian's humble truck parked among richer relations, including a spinner and a 1928 Dusenberg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The den.  It contains a collection of big game trophies, and among all this sits Sebastian very straight and proper with an "egg" the size of a basketball in his lap. Old Hannibal Chew was right, the rich make you wait. Sebastian stands and carefully makes his way between the trophies to a window with a view of the grounds.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyrell's young WIFE sits on the diving board watching her husband in the pool with their youngest TOT.  And two older LADS swim around trying to outdo each other for their dad's attention. From the sidelines an old servant pauses to watch the fun, then continues with a tray of mugs towards the house.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And beyond on a plateau overlooking the grounds, a figure stands watching, waiting like a bird of prey.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On a gravel path between shrubs of winter roses, Tyrell turns to observe the last quiet light over his kingdom. The moment is sweetened by the LOW PLAINTIVE BELLOW of one of the animals. He strolls by an old gardener who tips his cap, pro- ceeds up the steps and into his mansion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Next to a tray of cookies and milk, Sebastian sits pa- tiently with the "egg" in his lap.  As the door opens he gets to his feet expectantly.  It's STYLES, Tyrell's bodyguard.  He could play the Giant in Jack and The Beanstalk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, I'll take that now. Sebastian would rather put it in the boss's hands, but Styles takes it and is almost through the door when Sebastian stops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wait! He almost forgot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can't fly without the pilot. Sebastian hands him a little box.  Styles stuffs it in his pocket and shuts the door behind him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Motionless and monumental, six buffalo stand like stat- ues in the grass.  Suddenly they swing their shaggy heads to watch something pass. In the dark silence Batty stops to look at the curious beasts and then moves soundlessly towards the mansion.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a medieval-sized hall.  The piece de resistance is an 18th Century, English painting of an Arab stallion, gleaming like coal over the CRACKLING fireplace. The entire family is seated at the table which glitters for the festive occasion.  Presents gathered around the oldest child. Styles hands the "egg" to Tyrell.  A hush falls over the table.  This is Dad's big present.  Tyrell sets is down before the boy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: is a fresh, slim lad who is ten today.  He looks up at his father, then, beaming, pries open the "egg's" hinged lid.  Tyrell's hand goes to his pocket and the griffon steps out of the shell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh! Basically an avian invention, it has wings and plumage, the head of an eagle, the body of a lion and weighs no more than eight pounds.  It cranes its neck and testing its balance, stands on one leg and then hops to the edge of the table and into the air. The littlest tot claps her hands as the griffon beats its wings rapidly and rises towards the ceiling.  Turn- ing in a forty-five degree, it suddenly drops into a dive. Delighted, the children shriek and scream as the griffon swoops over their crouching heads and sails the length of the hall -- its silhouette flickering briefly over the ancestral portraits of the Tyrell clan. Reaching the end of the room, it banks sharply and flies back towards the table, cups its wings, spreads its tail and comes in for an awkward landing.  They're laughing and clapping as it waddles down the table and knocks over a glass and stops in front of Ian.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Papa!  Did you make this?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No.  We can make man, but not a griffon. He bends down and kisses his wife.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have to give the cottage industry a chance too. Pleased he excuses himself and heads for the den.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tyrell comes in and sits behind his desk.  Sebastian hands down the invoices.  Tyrell glances over them and writes out a check. He looks up to hand it over when he sees Batty against the wall, by the door.  For a fraction of a second he's shocked, but recovers fast.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A friend of yours, Sebastian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yes, this is someone who wants to talk to you, Dr. Tyrell. Batty smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The name is Batty.  Roy Batty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh? Very slowly Tyrell's hand moves towards the back side of the desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: To act without understanding could lead to the very thing the act seeks to avoid. What's in Batty's eyes completes the warning.  Tyrell decides to heed it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A little talk it all I need. Tyrell looks at Sebastian.  Considers consequences. Back to Batty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to talk in private then. Batty thinks it over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  It might be better if we talk in private, Sebastian.  Why don't you go home.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Here's your check, my boy.  Thank you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Thank you, Dr. Tyrell.  I'll see you later. He slips out closing the door behind him.  Opens it again and sticks his head it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Was everything okay?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just beautiful. He's gone. If Tyrell is scared he's doing a good job of concealing it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm surprised you didn't come to me sooner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's not an easy thing to meet your maker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: And what can he do for you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Can the maker repair what he makes?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Would you like to be modified?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Had in mind something a little more radical.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the problem?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Death.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'm afraid that's a little out of my... Batty cuts in with a whisper.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want more life, fucker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come here. Batty walks forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sit down. Batty does.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The facts of life.  I'll be blunt. To make an alteration in the evolvement of an organic life system, at least by men, makers or not, it fatal.  A coding sequence can't be revised once it's established.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because by the second day of incubation any cells that have undergone reversion mutation give rise to revertant colonies -- like rats leaving a sinking ship.  The ship sinks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What about E.M.S. recombination?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We've already tried it -- ethyl methane sulfonate is an alkylating agent and a potent mutagen -- it creates a virus so lethal the subject was destroyed before we left the table. Batty nods grimly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then a repressor protein that blocks the operating cells.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Wouldn't obstruct replication, but it does give rise to an error in replication, so that the newly formed DNA strand carries a mutation and you're got a virus again... but all this is academic
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: you are made as good as we could make you.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But not to last.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Put it this way.  Rolls Royces are made to last -- as least they were. But I'm afraid you're a Ferrari. A high strung racing car -- built to win, not to last. Batty smiles bitterly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Also you're too valuable to experiment with.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I am? Tyrell can't help a flash of pride.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The bast of all possible androids. We're proud of our prodigal son -- glad you're returned.  You're quite a prize. Shoulders hunched, Batty looks down, an uncharacteristic note of guilt in his voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I've done some questionable things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Also extraordinary things.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nothing the God of biomechanics wouldn't let you in heaven for. They share a laugh.  In spite of himself, there's a look of relief in Tyrell's face as Batty extends his hand. Tyrell takes it and they shake.  The reverence in Bat- ty's eyes caused Tyrell a fatherly smile.  The smile turns into a growl as he feels the bones in his hands crack.  Before the scream comes out of his mouth, Batty stifles it. Tyrell claws at the iron fingers, but they're sinking into his face.  Placing his other hand behind Tyrell's head, Batty squeezes them together and squashes the man's head like a melon.  The mess is not small. Palms up, like a surgeon, Batty walks to the drapes and wipes off the gore and without looking back, strolls out of the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Styles is coming down the hall.  He sees Batty coming towards him.  Styles looks at him curiously, this is not one of the guests.  As they close, Batty smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Could you tell me where the bathroom is? Styles doesn't get a chance to answer.  Batty's hand has torn into his crotch.  The man is lifted off the floor, up the wall and held a moment.  Whatever is encased in his pelvis is pulverized.  Batty lets go.  Styles hits the floor.  He died of shock.  Grinding his teeth, Batty continues towards the SOUNDS OF THE FESTIVITIES.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The birthday cake has arrived, the candles lit.  They're waiting for Dad.  Mrs. Tyrell looks around to find Batty observing from the doorway. A little startled, a little curious, but ever the cor- porate wife, she smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: May I help you? Batty smiles back and shakes his head in mock regrets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the sink the faucet is on.  The water pink with blood.  Batty is washing his hands. A portly maid emerges from the pantry.  Batty looks up. She stops, embarrassed at being caught.  Her eyes no- tice drops of blood on the floor and follow them to the door.  When she looks back, Batty is right in front of her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Books scattered on the bed.  Rachael sitting cross- legged with one in her lap, looking through exquisite shots of nature.  Deckard is next to her, watching her like a lover, like a father.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She'd never seen the great outdoors. Never even seen books on the subject.  She went through everything I had, and we talked. And there were subjects we didn't discuss and they were words we didn't say, I couldn't say, like death, like future, like real.  But it was hard because she was curious and full of questions.  She was more alive than anyone I'd ever known. She looks up stunned by the beauty of a photo, but with no need to comment.  It's in her eyes.  She stares at him, a revelation taking shape.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You and I are good friends, huh? He considers it and she stares at him, smiling at the wonder of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's so easy. Convinced and not convinced, he nods his head.  She laughs at his solemnity.  She's irresistible.  Deckard's pretty irresistible himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Have you ever known anybody a long time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You mean a woman?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Uh-huh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's a long time?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten years.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Nope.  Nobody could stand me that long. The CHIME on the PHONE next to the bed GOES OFF.  He reaches out and brings it to his ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is Bryant.  Are you alone?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She's not with you?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Who. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Take a number.  Canapt 1700, tenth floor, Villa Vita District, Olympia South.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, here it is.  Eldon Tyrell, his family and half his staff were just massacred.  The cat is about to get out of the bag.  Pressure is definitely on.  The Nexus program is terminated.  When you finish there, locate Nexus designated Rachael and retire. Deckard says nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: If you don't, we will.  It has to be total, Deckard.  That's an order from as high as it comes.  Got it?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Yeah.  I got it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Go. He hangs up the receiver and gets up.  She watches him from the bed.  The gun goes into his belt.  He loads the ankle job and straps it on.  She watches every move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Why do you call it retire, why don't you call it murder?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Because it's not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't you think anything that can suffer deserves to be considered?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Andies only simulate suffering -- if they're programmed for it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Do you think I simulated what happened between us?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, I don't. Without looking at her, he puts on his jacket. He's standing in the middle of the floor with his back to her.  He turns and they're facing one another. Neither of them moves.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Don't leave here.  Don't open the door, don't answer the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What difference will it make?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just wait here. He goes to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what I think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That some of the folks around here are more programmed then me. He has to laugh.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You know what else I think?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This was the best day of my life. He turns and goes through the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sebastian is putting his work table in order, but his mind is not with it and his hands are trembling. Batty, Pris and Mary are on the other side of the room talking:  their voices low.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Let's go while there is still time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Anywhere. Batty smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's the point?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not to be trapped.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You underestimate the trap, Mary. Sebastian has almost reached the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are you going, Sebastian?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Just thought I'd...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No, you stay here with us.  Out last night together. They all watch. Sebastian walks away from the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think of yourself as a light, Mary. Shine before you're turned off. She's too fragile for that logic, but it appeals to Pris.  She and Batty hold a look that burns. Sebastian is by the window.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Someone is coming here. Batty goes to the window and looks down.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One man. (he smiles) He must be good.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Then go get him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That wouldn't be very sporting. Sebastian looks ready to bolt.  Batty puts an arm around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I want to do it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Okay, but don't kill him.  Save a little for everybody.  A masterpiece. A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Turn out the lights, Pris.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the dim, nocturnal light, Deckard crosses into the courtyard fronting the building and stops.  He looks around.  Nobody there, just silence. He comes closer to the building and stands in the sha- dows off to one side of the entry. His head jerks up to the SOUND OF CRASHING GLASS. Sebastian comes hurtling down and explodes into the pavement thirty feet below. Deckard's eyes move up the line of descent, the shat- tered window on the next-to-top floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not much to see, But Deckard misses none of it as he crosses the floor and positions himself in the spot of least exposure.  He looks around.  Elevator and stair- well. Close to the wall, he moves towards the elevator, keep- ing an eye on the stairwell door. Stepping to one side, he hits the button.  The elevator door slides open.  He reaches in, presses a button and as the doors slide shut, Deckard slips a pen between the doors, jamming the operation. Deckard's shoes and soundless as he quickly crosses the lobby floor.  He pauses a moment in front of the stair- well door, then pushes it open and:
direction.name: direction

result.heading: GROWS TO A PIERCING SHRIEK AND ABRUPTLY STOPS

direction.raw_text: Steps into the dark on the other side.  Suddenly he spins, dropping to the floor, and FIRES three times in- to the figure hovering to his left. The man is hanging off the floor, his arms locked into the railing, neck broken -- with three holes in his chest... but he was already dead. Deckard stares at the corpse.  It's Mr. Deetchum, the old watchman.  That RUSTLING SOUND are rats who were feeding on him, scampering for safer places, Deckard gets to his feet. The stairway rectangles ten stories up.  As his foot touches the first step, a raw, terrified SCREAM shatters the air.  It came from below.  It's the cry of a young girl -- it GROWS TO A PIERCING SHRIEK AND ABRUPTLY STOPS.  Deckard ejects the half-used cartridge from his laser, inserts a fresh one and quiet as the silence, descends the basement stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At the bottom he faces a corridor.  The FAINT HUM OF MACHINERY comes from the double doors at the far end. The HUM BECOMES A RATTLE by the time he gets there. Each door is fitted with a small window.  Deckard steps to the side and peers through.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's a gym.  The mirror-lined walls are cracked and tarnished, the equipment atrophied from lack of use. The heavier barbells have sunk into the floor.  Two weight-reducing machines are flapping and grinding away like idiots.  Deckard's eyes stop on the woman. She dangles a few feet off the floor, hung by the shoulders through rings suspended from the ceiling. Her head is slung forward, her body limp and slightly swaying. Deckard pushes open one of the doors until it touches the wall.  Slowly, he advances toward the hanging figure, keeping an eye on the mirror to cover surprises from the door.  He's not breathing hard.  His heart isn't pound- ing.  Deckard's in his element. Close enough to look up into her face, he stops.  It isn't grisly death that causes the reaction in his eyes.  It's the innocence of her angel face. It's not something he has time to consider.  In the mirror behind him, he sees the door starting to open. Deckard spins.  He shouldn't have.  Pris' legs snap up, crack the laser out of his hand and clamp around his neck. Slowly, the door swings closed, but Deckard doesn't notice.  His carotid artery is no longer sending blood to the brain.  He jerks up his foot and reaches down. As his fingers close around the ankle laser, Pris' fingers close around his wrist.  Deckard's hand opens like a flower.  The laser drops to the floor as his eyes roll back into his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Naughty, naughty. She lets go, but before he can fall, she rams a foot into his back.  He's propelled fifteen feet across the room, slams into a machine and falls to the floor. Pris flies off the rings and comes at him. Deckard reaches out to pull himself up, but she's al- ready there.  Not too hard and just in the right place, she kicks him in the stomach.  He goes back to the floor, gagging for air.  Oh-so-precisely she reaches out with a long index finger and flips the switch on the machine. It's a flab eliminator with a vibrator belt.  Normally an innocuous piece of equipment, but the motor housing on this one is missing.  Lots of GRINDING METAL.  A bad place for flesh and bone. But that's where Deckard's hand is going.  An eight- year-old against a full-down man.  In two more seconds his hand will be ground round.  Deckard tries to pull his hand loose.  It won't come.  He yanks hard, but it's welded in hers. His face is twisted and strained as he raises a leg, wedges his foot against her chest and pushes with all his might.  The hold breaks.  They topple back.  Deckard hits the floor gulping to catch his breath.  Pris is up and coming for him again.  She hovers over him.  Deckard rolls out of the way as she comes down like a pile driver. Reflexively Deckard raises his arm to protect himself. Pris just smiles, takes hold of his foot and drags him across the floor.  She doesn't like to leave a piece of work unfinished.  They're going back to the machine. He goes by a weight-stand of dumbbells and grabs hold. It doesn't stop him.  He's sliding over the floor like it was ice, weight stand in tow. Pris gets to the machine, yanks his foot up and forces it toward the opening.  Deckard sits up, a five-pound dumbbell in his hand, and clobbers her in the back.  It knocks her off balance, but she doesn't let go of his foot.  She hooks out with a fist but misses.  He gets her with a roundhouse in the face. She goes to the floor and Deckard's up, the dumbbell over his head, coming down with it.  Fighting for her life now, Pris drives a foot into his chest.  It lifts him off the floor.  He flies back across the gym and lands in a heap. No more games.  Pris is furious and moving fast.  She rips a steel bar out of the wall and, holding it over- head, charges him like a samurai.  As she comes down for the kill, she freezes. Deckard landed near the laser.  He crawls towards it. As in a nightmare, it takes forever.  But he gets there. He reaches out and grabs the laser, rolls over and takes careful aim.  She charges towards him, screaming her rage.  He FIRES as she comes. The shot amputates her left arm at the shoulder, but her hand doesn't let go of the bar.  It dangles crazily in front of her as she charges forward. He PUTS THE NEXT ONE through her neck.  Pris hiccups a rope of blood as she flies through the air and crashes next to Deckard.  Dead. He lies next to her, chest heaving.  Slowly he rolls over and gets to his hands and knees.  Panting, he stag- gers to his feet and stands over her, swaying slightly. The sound that escapes his throat is raspy and dry.  It might not sound like a war cry, but it is.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Laser in hand, Deckard kicks open the swinging doors and walks into the corridor, a dangerous man.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard arrives at the main floor landing, checks his loads and continues up the stairs.  He's going to shoot the next thing that moves and find out later if he was right or wrong.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the next landing he throws the door open.  His eyes move down the hall, looking for prints in the dust. None.  He continues up the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On the ninth floor he finds what he's looking for. Footprints coming and going from a door halfway down the hall.  He stops to the side of it and listens.  Silence. Deckard FIRES three quick shots through the door.  If somebody were on the other side of it, they aren't now. He kicks the door open and dives through head first and hits the floor in a roll, POURING FIRE into the far corners of the room but the room is empty.  There's a kitchen bar, a closet and a bedroom door, both closed.  Deckard's breathing is the only sound.  No response from either door. Maybe it was a sound, maybe intuition, but suddenly Deckard twists around and FIRES several shots into the closet.  The smouldering door slowly creaks open. Mary is huddled in the rear of the closet.  Her hand out like somebody about to catch a ball but afraid of it.  In her other hand she clutches a button-eyed monkey.  Her face is bewildered, frozen in fear, her body riddled with holes.  No recognition gap here. Deckard SHOOTS her through the neck to make sure.  Mary falls to the floor, like a puppet with her strings cut. Deckard backs away from the pathetic figure in the closet and sits on the sofa, unable to take his eyes off her. Deckard lays the laser down next to him, holds out his hand and looks at it.  It's steady.  He drops it in his lap, closes his eyes and leans back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: from the ceiling.  Deckard looks up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: with the proverbial DOUBLE RAP at the end. A pause.  Deckard jumps out of the way as the ceiling gives in.  Chucks on concrete and plaster hit the couch where he was sitting.  The hole is a couple feet in diameter -- beams cracked through, exposing the apartment above.  Silence.  Deckard wipes the plaster dust from his eyes and mouth, then whispers:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hello, Roy.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard comes out onto the landing.  Taking his time, he climbs the steps to the next floor, the last floor. He SHOOTS the hinges out of the big stairwell door, pushes it with his foot and it comes down with a BANG. The REVERBERATIONS turn into silence.  The corridor is empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Moving fast but cautious, he passes each door until he gest to the apartment above Sebastian's.  Slowly he turns the know and pushed open the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Except for the hole in the middle of the floor, there's nothing to see.  Back against the wall, he moves to- wards the bedroom, but stops at the NOISE.  It sounds like the HOOTING OF AN OWL and it's coming from the hallway.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard looks around the corner of the door down the hall.  Batty's at the other end.  Except for jockstrap and gym shoes, he's nude.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You wanna play? Deckard FIRES.  Batty's fast.  He ducks into a doorway. Pops out again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not very sporting to fire on an unarmed opponent.  I thought you were supposed to be good.  Aren't you the man?! The makeup on Batty's face is somewhere between a Coman- che warrior and a transvestite.  The immensity of his insolence awesome -- the muscles of his body are swol- len, trembling from the thrill of it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This is how we do it up there, lad! Come on! In a blue of lightning-like action, Batty whips down the hall, zigzagging off the walls towards Deckard so fast that Deckard gets only three SHOTS off before the blur crashes through the wall on his left with a laugh. Deckard stands there a moment -- digesting the impact of it, then edges up to the gaping wall.  Batty is be- hind him. He knees Deckard in the back and slaps him in the head. Deckard goes to his knees, then over on his face. Batty kneels next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Not hurt, are you?  You better get it up or I'm going to have to kill you.  Unless you're alive you can't play.  And if you don't play, you don't get to be alive. Deckard's eyes are closed, mouth bleeding.  He exhales and makes and effort.  He slides his hands up even with his chest and starts to push.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's the spirit. Like a matador, Batty walks away.  By the time Deckard's on his feet, Batty's disappeared through one of the doors. Deckard wipes the blood from his mouth, bends down and picks up his laser, reloads and looks down the hall, towards the jeering voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, Deckard, show me what you got!  I'm right here on the other side of the door.  But you gotta shoot straight 'cause I'm fast! Deckard gets to the door, BLASTS it, kicks it open and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: at Batty.  But it's only the reflection of Batty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The full length mirror on the other side of the room
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Batty's next to him, grabs Deckard's hand and steps in closer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Straight doesn't seem to be good enough. They're face to face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: You don't have a chance, do you? In an exaggeration of weary disappointment, Batty drops his head to the side.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Looks like I'm gonna have to scale it down for you.  Give you a handicap.  I won't run through any more walls.  Okay?  I promise to use the doors.  Okay? Deckard stares back at him, but doesn't respond.  Sud- denly fury storms through Batty.  He throws Deckard out the door, knocking him down, grabs him by the collar and rams his head into the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Come on, let's use that brain!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He drags him down the hall, on his knees and bangs his head into the wall again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Think!  We need a little resilience around here! He yanks him further and bashes his head again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where are those balls of yours?! Let's see a little bravery! The storm passes. Deckard hangs in Batty's hand like a bag of laundry.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That was irrational of me -- not to mention unsportsmanlike.  Won't happen again. He drops him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: I'll be down the hall when you're ready. Betty walks off and disappears through one of the doors. Deckard gets to his knees, leans against the wall a mo- ment, then punches it with his fist. On his feet he's a little wobbly.  Holding his breath so he can hear above his own breathing, he listens.  No sound.  No sign of Batty.  The laser is laying nearby. He doesn't bother. Deckard is backing down the hall, quiet as he can.  He had a job to do.  He would like to have done it, but he's not insane.  He gets to the landing and turns. On the first step down, he stops.  Batty's on the land- ing below, looking up at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Where you going? He wait a moment for Deckard's answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No cheating.  A promise is a promise.  I'll honor the handicapped, but we gotta play on the top floor.  You go get your laser gun now.  And I'll give you a few seconds before I come. Deckard turns back into the hall.  Batty smiles. Deckard's running down the corridor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One! Halfway down the hall he finds his laser.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Two! Deckard darts into the nearest door.  The apartment above Sebastian's, with the hole in the floor.  Deckard considers it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: No fair jumping through holes.  You might get hurt doing that!  THREE! Deckard dashes back into the hall, chooses another door and goes in.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes skim over everything, looking for an advantage. He throws open a door.  The bathroom.  The plumbing is dismantled, walls stripped, revealing brick, nails protruding.  Too small.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Batty's coming up the steps.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Five!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard's looking for a corner -- a place that covers the angles.  He chooses the far side of the room with a line to the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Batty's coming down the center, listening at the doors.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Six!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard's crouched in the corner and aimed.  He looks at his hand.  It's trembling.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Seven!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Batty's standing in front of a door, listening.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Oh, I wonder where he is.  Not in here, I don't think.  Eight! He goes to the next door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Maybe here.  Doesn't sound like it.  Nine! Batty moves to the next.  The door to Deckard.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard's crouched lower, holding his breath -- talk about a hair trigger... Silence.  Batty's FEET are heard
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .  Deckard looks around.  Runs a hand over the wall behind him.  Batty's FEET COME BACK.  A pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ten! The door explodes! A shape hurtles across the room.  Deckard pivots, fol- lowing it with RAPID FIRE.  It's a TV.  He spins back. but Batty's already on him.  He gets one SHOT off be- fore Batty's got his hand.  There's a hole over Batty's right eye.  Blood running down his face, dripping on Deckard.  The right side of his face isn't working too good.  The corner of his mouth doesn't quite shut -- his voice comes out slurred, a little hollow.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: One point for you. The would doesn't minimize his omnipotence, just makes it more malignant.  He throws Deckard against the far wall.  Deckard FIRES.  Hits Batty in the shoulder.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ho ho!  Try it again! He comes at Deckard, jerking back and forth, a cobra in fast motion, faking, weaving, yelping with excitement as Deckard tries to get a shot, FIRING AWAY until his laser's empty.  Bloody and crazed, Batty pushes up against him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?  Don't you like me? I'm what we've made!
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He's backing Deckard out the door.  Deckard trips and falls.  There's fear on his face.  The strength is gone. Something is starting to crack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: What's wrong?  Aren't you a lover of Faster, Bigger and Better?! Deckard's pedaling backwards over the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It's time to die. Deckard throws the laser at him.  It misses.  Batty throws his head back and laughs.  A one-eyed colossus about to eat the world.  Suddenly he stops.  His eye moves over the wall.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ah! He reaches out and pinches something.  His lips compress as he yanks it out of the wall.  It's a ten-penny nail. He holds it out to Deckard and drops it.  Deckard catches it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: That's for you. One side of Batty's face smiles savagely.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Stick it in your ear and push. If that doesn't work, try the eye. Deckard stares at the nail in his hand, then up at his executioner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Believe me, it'll be better for you than what I'm about to do. Batty watches him, hoping the stimulus might inspire his victim to more action.  It doesn't look like it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Well? Deckard springs to his feet and bolts.  But instead of going for the stairwell he turns in the first available door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: #2 - NIGHT                   117 Provocation accomplished. Batty smiles and walks lei- surely towards the door.  Deckard's terrified scream and the SOUND of GLASS CRASHING stop him.  Batty speeds up and moves into the room. The window pane is splattered, curtains sucked out, bellowing in the wind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Crap. He walks up to the window.  Deckard comes away from the wall, inching up behind him, laser in both hands, aimed at the base of Batty's skull.  Batty starts to lean over, but even before his eyes see the pavement, he knows.  He spins... Deckard FIRES again.  This one goes home.  Batty falls like he was poleaxed, hits the floor dead weight. Deckard starts to tremble.  His arms go limp as his head tilts back and he closes his eyes.  He can breathe again. On the floor, Batty's hand is crawling toward Deckard's ankle. With the unsuspected abruptness of a man slipping on a banana peel, Deckard comes down.  Face knotted in hor- ror, he EMPTIES THE LASER in Batty's body -- but the hand holds on.  With a screech of frustration he drops the laser and like an animal claws at Batty's dead fingers -- but the fingers are welded shut. Deckard starts to crawl, pulling Batty behind him.  He struggled through the door and stumbles to his feet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard plunges down the corridor dragging Batty along. He falls, gets to one foot, falls again and crawls the last couple feet to the stairwell.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: SOUND OF HIS BODY HITTING BELOW

direction.raw_text: Groaning, he tugs and pulls, hauls and heaves Batty's body to the edge of the landing.  He pauses for breath, then lays back, wedging his feet against Batty's shoul- ders and pushes.  Inch by inch the body goes over the edge.  Then all at once it drops.  But the hand holds and the weight of the body takes Deckard with it.  As Deckard slides over the edge, he grabs hold of the railing. Deckard's hanging three hundred feet over the basement floor, supporting himself and Batty's corpse -- almost four hundred pounds of stress on his fingers. With his free foot he chops away at Batty's hand, try- ing to break it loose.  But it's not working.  Deckard's fingers are starting to slip. His face is a mask of agony as he wedges his heel over Batty's thumb.  With the help of gravity and everything he's got in his right leg to push with, he pushes.  The thumb breaks loose.  Batty falls. The SOUND OF HIS BODY HITTING BELOW sounds good, but Deckard doesn't notice.  He's in an awkward position. He must reverse the way he's facing to pull himself up. He lets go with his right hand and crosses it over the left.  Then turns the left around so he's got an over- hand grip. Like a man doing his last pull-up... the one that can't be done, Deckard pulls himself up, throws a foot over the edge and grapples and heaves and wiggled himself onto the cold solid steel of the stairwell landing. And lies there, body jerking spasmodically, slowly clenching and unclenching his cramped hand, but it's his burning cheek against the cool metal he's most aware of. Dizzy, hot, lungs on fire, he stands -- and putting one foot in front of the other, Deckard descends the stairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Slowly the door pushes open and Deckard comes out into the morning.  The sun isn't yet risen, but the sky has begun to pale.  It's a brooding gray stew of a dawn not very pretty, but even though he can't show it, Deckard is glad to see it. For a moment he tilts his head back and takes some breath, then walks across the courtyard towards the street, so dead on his feet he hasn't the energy to fall. Deckard slumps into the shelter of his car.  The col- lapses on the front seat.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In a corner of the dimness Deckard sits slumped on a chair, facing the pearly gray light of the window.  The only SOUND in the room is the soft steady BREATHING that comes from the bed. Quietly he gets up and walks over to her.  Rachael lies sleeping, one delicate arm exposed from under the sheet. Deckard stands there, bettered and grim, staring down at her. Moments go by and finally he sits gently on the edge of the bed. Rachael opens her eyes, and looks up at him, she smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard's car is skimming over the narrow highway.  He and Rachael in the front seat.  Except for the occasion- al glance, their faces are still and quiet in the cold shine of an icy dream. The clouds overhead are soft and swift.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She wanted to go to a place I knew. Out of the city.  Like one of those pictures she saw.  Where there were trees but no buildings. Rachael's face in the window watching the woods stream by.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We had a good time.  She told me a funny story and I taught her a song.  A song about monkeys and elephants.  And it made us laugh so hard we couldn't sing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard and Rachael walking.  The land lays white and hushed before them. Down an aisle of maples and beeches.  The frosty light slanting through the clean, hard limbs. The crisp, blue-white snow underfoot melted through in spots exposing soggy patches of rich brown earth. Rachael stops and faces him.  Her lips are parted, her warm breath turning the cold air to vapor.  Looking lithe and fragile by these barren-rooted trees, she stands in the crisp white snow looking at Deckard. Nothing in her retreats, even now her eyes insist on knowing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Deckard walking over the snow.  Alone.  He walks slowly, mechanically through the cold, unaffected by it.  His gaunt face, empty of expression except for the tears running down his pale cheeks. But for the SQUEAK of his wet shoes over the crusted snow, there is no sound.  And Deckard recedes into the silence of the freezing white landscape.
direction.name: direction
